acf.heading: Get Flovent (fluticasone) online.
acf.first_paragraph: Asthma symptoms can be difficult to manage, but fluticasone (the generic version of Flovent) can help with this. It can relieve symptoms such as wheezing, stuffy nose, itching and sneezing associated with asthma and allergies. Flovent does not activate immediately and should not be used for sudden asthma attacks.

accordion.accordion_title: What is Flovent and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: The generic brand of Flovent is fluticasone. This medication belongs to a class of drugs known as corticosteroids. It works by controlling and reducing the swelling of airways such as in the nasal cavities, to support proper breathing, and reducing asthma flare-ups.
accordion.accordion_content: If you think you need Flovent, you can speak to a doctor on Maple to see if it is right for you.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses for Flovent?
accordion.accordion_intro: Flovent is used to relieve common asthma symptoms, which often result in blocked or constrained airways. This can lead to wheezing, stuffy noses, difficulty breathing, and more serious issues if not treated. Flovent takes time to activate so it should not be used for immediate asthma attacks.
accordion.accordion_content: You can find out if you have asthma symptoms by speaking to a doctor on Maple here.

accordion.accordion_intro: If you are using the over-the-counter product to self-treat, read and follow all directions on the product package before using this medication. Use this medication through an inhaler as directed by your doctor or the product package, usually once or twice a day. Do not spray in your eyes. Shake the container gently before each use.
accordion.accordion_content: It’s important to speak to your doctor to find out the right dosage and frequency of the medication for you.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of Flovent?
accordion.accordion_intro:
You should always speak with a doctor to make sure that Flovent is right for you. Possible side effects include:

  • Nasal dryness/irritation
  • Nausea
  • Vomiting may occur
  • Unusual/extreme tiredness
  • Weight loss
  • Headache
  • Swelling ankles/feet
  • Increased thirst/urination
  • Vision problems
accordion.accordion_content: Tell your doctor right away if you have any worsening side effects or symptoms.

accordion.accordion_intro: Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of: recent nose problems (such as injury, ulcers, surgery), infections (including tuberculosis, herpes eye infection), certain eye problems (glaucoma, cataracts), liver disease.
accordion.accordion_content: If you have any questions about the medication, you can speak to a doctor on Maple by registering for an account.
